results.title: Head of Sales
results.description:
About Spot

At Spot, we know that just about everyone thinks insurance has never been cool or exciting. It's boring, complicated, and something we all hope we never use. That’s why we’re turning the insurance industry on its head by building the first lifestyle brand in the insurance world, encouraging our customers to live life to the fullest knowing we've got their back.

Spot is the first insurance company that helps its customers have fun while living their best lives, whether learning how to ski, riding a local mountain bike trail, or training to summit Everest. We cover people’s medical bills when shit hits the fan.

We were founded by avid skiers, cyclists, and outdoor enthusiasts, so we understand the risks that come with the territory. When bad things happen, dealing with insurance can make it worse. We believe our community deserves something better.

With over a million customers and growing, we have no intention of slowing down. ﻿

Our Team

We believe in the importance of culture and community and that teams thrive when working in alignment.

Key Attributes

  1. Visionary
  2. Collaborative
  3. Data obsessed
  4. Problem solving
  5. Results driven
  6. Takes initiative

Key Functional Competencies

  1. Strong leadership and influence skills
  2. Talent development
  3. Adaptability
  4. Analytical

Why This Role Is Important to Us

This position is responsible for delivering Spot’s revenue growth commitments, aligning and managing the aspects of Sales and BDR teams and processes that will drive our revenue growth. This role is pivotal in directly influencing the future of a company, including the GTM strategy and new verticals. As part of Spot’s leadership team, this role will directly report to the Chief Revenue Officer.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with CRO to develop, lead and execute strategic Sales initiatives
  • Oversee Spot’s sales development and GTM sales strategy and objectives; developing a robust sales management processes – from pipeline to close
  • Pursue a deep understanding of Spot’s potential Partners and their needs to refine our ICP and GTM strategies over time
  • Collaborate across teams, including Engineering, Product, Marketing, Partner Success, Finance, and Operations, to communicate revenue strategies and adjust priorities according to feedback and company objectives
  • Own processes, metrics, and best practices that yield a high-performance sales team
  • Evangelize the product and personally help close large deals
  • Partner with Revenue leadership to develop annual sales strategies, plans, and tactics to drive revenue, expand the Partner base and maximize short- and long-term revenue potential from existing and future Partners
  • Drive Spot’s vertical/partner development strategy, increasing our market shares and improving our win rates across segments we touch
  • Establish and manage a sustainable, predictable, and scalable sales architecture

Who You Are

  • Motivating and leading teams gets you out of bed in the morning
  • Solving for rapid growth inspires you
  • You have experience building and running high-performance sales team
  • You are a tenacious, hands-on closer
  • You are an expert in identifying and developing customer value - translating functionality into C-level value propositions and positive business outcomes for partners and consumers
  • Your knowledge of sales processes and methodologies teamed with creativity in lead generation helps you to transform opportunities into concrete outcomes, including the efficient use of CRM tools
  • You are intellectually agile; a strategic thinker who can think deeply and quantitatively to solve problems
  • Collaboration is core to who you are
  • You say it like it is

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental & Vision
  • 401k
  • Flexible PTO (Vacation, Sick & Holidays)
  • Parental Leave
  • Fully Remote

results.title: Enterprise Account Manager
results.description:
Inside Real Estate is a fast-growing, profitable, privately-held company and a technology leader in the real estate industry. In an industry where fluctuation is often the norm, we don’t merely adapt. We create. We innovate. We lead. We discover solutions to new challenges and make something remarkable. We are on a mission to simplify workflows for Real Estate companies around the country, and we are looking to add to our team.

An Enterprise Account Manager is responsible for the success of their book of business. Your mission is to help customers grow by driving value and providing creative solutions to their business problems using our strong portfolio of products and services. Success is measured by specific key performance indicators such as client adoption, engagement, growth and retention individually and as a department.


Responsibilities
  • Consistently achieve quarterly growth and retention goals
  • Own overall relationship with the customer post sale
  • Drive adoption and engagement through consulting and strategizing with your clients through meaningful touchpoints like business reviews.
  • Analyze client use-cases and recommend best practices to optimize product usage, adoption and ROI
  • Ability to manage and prioritize customer requests and internal responsibilities to meet KPI’s, (Retention, Growth and Adoption)
  • Work with onboarding managers and implementation to ensure a seamless transition into live status.
  • Effectively manage a high volume of inbound customer requests, align them with internal resources and anticipate their business needs.
  • Identify challenges and engage in proactive client meetings to positively impact customer loyalty and to align business goals
  • Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders
  • Fair Housing Standards Training is required and will be administered for this position

Requirements

  • 5+ years in a customer-facing role (Customer Success / Account Management / Sales), ideally for enterprise software, service or Software as a Service (SaaS) company
  • Ability to manage complex issues and coordinate solutions across multiple business channels
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Ability to present to clients, peers and superiors
  • Proactive, well-organized, and strong attention to detail
  • Passionate about customer success and thrives in a fast paced environment
  • Critical thinking and problem solving
  • Knowledge of the real estate industry
  • Strong team player
  • Negotiation
  • Coachable

Benefits

At Inside Real Estate enjoy:

  • Small company feel, with big company growth, support and stability
  • Competitive compensation, bonus opportunities, and great benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, FSA, 401k Retirement Savings, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays
  • 401K Employer Matching
  • Company paid Parental Leave
  • A focus on driving top results in a fun environment
  • Opportunities to grow within our company
  • Potential to work in a remote setting
  • Exciting/energetic work environment and fun, creative culture
EEO

We believe that the unique contributions of all Insiders is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

results.title: Sales Rep for Residential Leasing Platform
results.description:
ShowMojo streamlines the residential rental process, and vastly improves the leasing experience for property managers and renters alike. Our company is growing rapidly, with customers in all 50 states. To learn more about us visit: showmojo.com

Values

ShowMojo strives to connect individuals that closely align with our values:

  • Do you have the confidence to exchange opinions in an open environment with respectful candor?
  • Are you self-directed and able to proactively solve problems?
  • Do you pride yourself on showing up prepared and feel personal responsibility to see your accountabilities through to completion?

If this resonates with your personal values, we would like to have a career discussion with you.

Overview

We are looking for US based sales professionals who are self-motivated, have positive energy, and bring enthusiasm into the role. Our sales team members enjoy working independently, but also interact in healthy team-based collaboration.

ShowMojo's sales team uses an online approach to land business-to-business sales. This starts with prospecting and warming up leads to build a funnel of interested prospects, progresses into online demos and closing calls to get to the sale, and finishes off with follow-up calls to ensure the sale is onboarded and happy.

Activities throughout the week can vary. Some days could have a heavy focus on dialing and prospecting to refresh your pipeline. Other days could be filled with online demos, where you need to present and demonstrate sometimes complicated concepts (related to leasing automation and emerging leasing best practices) in simple, user-friendly terms. Other days could be closing calls and building your referral chain.

Some travel is required. You'll be expected to attend up to a dozen trade shows and industry-related events each year. Property management or real estate experience -- while helpful -- is not required for this position. We will help you get up to speed on the domain.

Our company is fully remote. We hire based on technical self-reliance. You should be comfortable (and even excited) working with and learning about current technologies.

Requirements

  • Have meaningful experience with cold calling and closing calls. Solid and professional written communication skills.
  • Ability to professionally and personably communicate with business owners and critical stakeholders.
  • Have experience presenting with online tools like Zoom, Join.me or Webex.
  • Self-manage your prospecting and sales activities -- calling, emailing and demoing throughout the day -- in order to hit daily, weekly and monthly targets.
  • Maintain new and existing customer connections and activities within our CRM.
  • Have a quiet office (home or elsewhere) with a strong internet connection and a newer computer.

Benefits

This is a salaried position, including both base and commission. The advertised compensation range combines both salary and commission.

Available benefits include health insurance, dental, vision, and 401k.

results.title: Chief Growth Officer
results.description:
About Us

imaware's mission is to change the world of healthcare and at-home testing. There's never been a more important time to help empower people to take control of and understand their health - all while pushing the boundaries of what 'modern healthcare' should really look like. We're looking for people who will help us think bigger, challenge the status quo, and add to a collaborative mindset of continuous learning. We are obsessed with creating a seamless and simple experience to make sure that our patients are well cared for, no matter where our products meet them in their journey. imaware™ team members all have a shared passion for answering tough questions in the pursuit of helping our customers, and one another.

Our team has adapted to a hybrid work environment, and work collaboratively both in our Austin office and from home. Despite many of our team members being in different locations and time zones, we're putting in the effort to make sure that our people are connected, cared for, and supported so we can all participate in building a culture that stems from a shared purpose.

As a result, imaware was named as one of BuiltIn's Best Small Places to Work for 2022!

About the Role

imaware's evolution from strictly a direct-to-consumer home-based testing product to a much larger business-to-business offering and digital healthcare platform has created tremendous opportunities ahead! We find ourselves on the cusp of explosive growth and are looking for an experienced Chief Growth Officer who can not only lay the foundations of our sales organization, but also inform key product decisions, grow, and cultivate existing accounts, and consistently close on new business.

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Growth Officer will be responsible for growing imaware's B2B business, building imaware's sales and GTM strategy, and the development of key partnerships to increase sales and market value. As a subject matter expert in the medical, health, and wellness space, you will inform Product team members on key market demands, and act as a true business ally for all Partners to tailor the absolute best solution for them and their customers. You will sign new MSAs, support Customer Experience teams, formulate a larger sales strategy, build a sales playbook, and ultimately grow our market footprint across key areas. If you're excited to sell more than just a product, but a larger story that will ultimately impact the health and happiness of countless patients, then here are just a few achievements we can't wait to see you accomplish:

● Critical key leadership role on the Executive Leadership team and an external ambassador of the company

● Build a strong sales team to support targeted market segments

● Sign new, strategic MSAs in order to meet annualized revenue goals and markedly improve our market footprint across major segment areas

● Lead the Customer Experience and Client Success teams with the progress of existing Partners, building new revenue streams through additional tailored offerings

● Collaborate with other cross-functional departments, from building out a go-to-market strategy ideating new offerings with Product, budgeting and forecasting with Finance & Accounting, to working with Lab Operations on new testing capabilities

● Research, formulate, codify, and execute on a repeatable sales strategy and playbook that will be used to train future business development and customer success team members

Minimum Requirements

● 15+ years of hands-on sales or business development and leadership experience selling services and solutions, primarily within the health and wellness market (ideally diagnostics)

● Successful track record of building go-to-market strategies across functions and exceeding sales goals, targets, and selling complex SaaS solutions to the C-Suite and executive level in life sciences

● Demonstrable experience selling products and services with nuanced and variable pricing models, working with Finance & Accounting on budgeting, forecasting, and invoicing

● Experience working with various sales CRMs, Marketing and Lead Gen solutions, and Business Intelligence solutions (Salesforce, etc.)

● Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills, able to build relationships while persuading key decision-makers

● Willingness to travel up to approximately 50% of the year

Preferred Qualifications

● Prior experience working within a startup or early-stage company is highly preferred

● Prior senior leadership experience building and leading teams

● Prior knowledge of lab testing preferred

● Bachelor's degree

Benefits and Perks

● Partially and fully covered medical benefits

● Fully covered dental, vision, life, short and long-term disability

● Paid vacation and holidays

● Flexible work environment

● 401K

● 20 days of PTO

● $75 continuing education stipend per quarter

● Free imaware tests

● Virtual and in-person team building activities/social events

Sound like a great fit? Apply now, we'd love to meet you!

results.title: Senior Manager of Partner Enablement
results.description:
We have an opening for a Senior Manager of Partner Enablement to join our growing Partnerships team. This role will be the primary driver of key relationships, building rapport, buy in, and shared value with our strategic partner network. We’d expect this individual to play a significant role in shaping the culture and operational processes for a growing department and be a key driver of revenue for the wider organization. This role will report to our Senior Director of Partnerships.

An ideal candidate will be motivated by strategically maximizing channels to revenue, nurturing strategic relationships, and is energized by playing a pivotal role in an ambitious, mission orientated start up. In this role, your core responsibilities will include:

  • Support day-to-day relationship management for strategic partners, expanding and ensuring both parties’ success
  • Own go-to-market activity, planning and metrics for our ecosystem of Channel partners and VARs.
  • Regularly monitor and nurture health metrics of existing partners.
  • Drive revenue for Sustain Life, based on quarterly goals through generating business with new and established partners, through a combination of enablement and co-selling activity.
  • Driving lead generation with existing partners will include monthly relationship development calls (or more as appropriate based on partner and leadership guidance), quarterly business reviews, and co-marketing activities.
  • Identify and build relationships with multiple stakeholders within an accounting or tech consulting firm.
  • Qualify and conduct deep discovery with net new Accounting/VARs partners and build account plans to drive revenue through the channel account.
  • Deeply understand seller and buyer needs in the partner ecosystem to provide actionable insights for engineering and the broader GTM team
  • Utilizing HubSpot and other PRM and CRM platforms to generate and manage a healthy pipeline of partnership opportunities.

Who you are:

  • 4-6 years of work in partnerships, sales or channel sales, with a track record of exceeding targets
  • Startup experience. You’ve helped build new businesses from the ground up
  • Have familiarity with common SaaS tooling such as Hubspot, ZoomInfo, and implementing PRM systems is a plus
  • Extremely organized individual comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Ability to function and contribute within a team, while also having willingness to accomplish tasks individually successfully
  • Have an open-minded desire to learn, grow and adapt as your responsibilities evolve
  • Effective time management skills with an ability to identify and prioritize essential tasks
  • Outstanding oral and written communication skills
  • Comfortable with a remote working environment

Bonus - experience we'd love to see

  • Startup experience. You’ve helped build new businesses from the ground up
  • A passion for sustainability - You care about climate change and want to be part of the solution

 

Interested? Great - we'd love to talk to you! Please apply to the role on our website https://boards.greenhouse.io/sustainlife. 

If you don’t check every box, don’t let that stop you. We prioritize talent, passion, and drive over what looks good on paper. If you’re on the fence, we encourage you to hit the apply button and highlight what draws you to Sustain.Life.

Sustain.Life is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Women/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Age

 

Who we are:

Sustain.Life is a high-energy early-stage Climate Tech start-up that focuses on providing ESG solutions to our customers to support their ambitions to address the most challenging questions of our time. Our sustainability platform specializes in B2B solutions for corporate sustainability efforts, offering innovative technology solutions and industry experience to support business targets, personal goals and a vision of a sustainable future for everybody on the planet. We are building a team that will help our users launch sustainability programs,, benchmark their ESG performance, measure carbon emissions, set meaningful goals, execute reduction strategies, and ultimately share their progress with key stakeholders. We are on a mission to create best-in-class software that changes the world.

Join us in our mission! We are a fully remote workforce collaborating across US, UK and Ireland. We have an incredible team of world-class experts, designers and technologists developing our sustainability platform, and we were finalists in the 2022 SXSW. We believe in our mission, and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us and help us grow.

At Sustain.Life, we take our mission seriously. In 2021, our entire carbon footprint was only 120 Metric Tons of carbon, which we offset on behalf of our employees. Our platform helps us understand our impact on the environment and to take the necessary steps to reduce that impact.

results.title: Head of Sales Development
results.description:
Growbots was born in Warsaw in December 2014 with the aspiration to change the world of sales. We want to become the #1 choice for SMBs worldwide to find new business opportunities with outbound.

 

Our vision is simple - we integrate data about all businesses worldwide with an outreach automation solution, allowing our clients to connect with their potential customers within a couple of minutes. What the steam engine did for the industrial worker, Growbots has done for the sales representatives!

 

Our clients are primarily located in the USA, we have more than 600 paying customers, and the numbers are still growing! Interested? If you want to know more about how we work and educate our future clients, click here.

 

About the role

We are currently on the lookout for the Head of Sales Development to join us on our sales-hacking mission. Your main responsibility in this role will be leading our well-established team of SDRs (5 Outbound, 1 Inbound) and pushing their performance and process excellence to the next level. You'll also be a part of the Senior Management team, contributing to the overall strategy and direction of the company.


It is an ideal role for someone who's passionate about Sales Development/Outbound Sales and has a strong mindset for continuous improvement.


You'll be proud of what you're working on! Join us!

 

Responsibilities:

  • managing the team of 6 SDRs - making sure that they're happy and that they're performing at the highest possible level
  • owning the core (top) part of our sales funnel: making sure that the calendars of our Account Executives are full of qualified opportunities
  • continuously working on our Outbound Sales strategy to ensure a strong pipeline AND expansion of our internal outbound sales know-how
  • sharing that know-how with all interested parties: our services team (so that they can educate our customers better), our marketing team (so that they can create quality content), our sales team (so that they can be true subject matter experts), and our product team (so that they can build a better product).
  • fine-tuning the process of qualification and conversion of inbound requests generated by our marketing team
  • owning additional initiatives with the purpose of generating more qualified opportunities (e.g., Affiliate Program).

Must-haves:

  • prior success in a sales development leadership role (process & people)
  • true passion for Outbound Sales/Sales Development
  • mindset for continuous improvement and being a learning machine - always looking for new ways to do your job better and better
  • have the ability to motivate your team to crave constantly more knowledge and share it with others
  • extreme ownership in terms of setting challenging goals and embracing them to grow as individual and as a team
  • always putting people first - always having good intentions on your mind and giving valuable feedback is the key here
  • always understanding and taking into consideration the broader perspective

 

Nice to have:

  • experience in managing the outbound sales process for both service and product companies
  • experience in working with a product that combines self-service with high-touch sales

 

Perks

$$$, working hours & time-off

  • Fair salary related to your skills and experience, 12k-20k PLN net (B2B) / 9,9k-16,6k PLN gross (CoE/UoP)

  • Guaranteed time-off (26 paid vacation days) & sick leave

  • Flexible working hours

Your work & your impact
  • Selling the product that you believe in (every salesperson that had ever touched sales prospecting does)
  • Building on top of a well-established team will allow you to achieve true sales process excellence
  • Opportunity to have an impact on almost every part of our organization - Outbound Sales is the centerpiece of what we do!

Best tools and comfortable workplace

  • MacBook and industry-standard tools to work with

  • You'll be able to work in your preferred way - either remotely, or in a unique, dog-friendly office in the old cheese factory in the center of Warsaw (the Hoża street)

Benefits

  • Private medical care with Medicover (optional Family Package)
  • Multisport card
  • Mental Health Support Budget
  • Gallup CliftonStrengths Talent Assessment
  • Additional day-off for volunteering
  • Sabbatical Leave
  • Annual company retreat, Growbots Birthday party and even more team- & company-wide integrations
  • We support your growth - Growbots covers up to 70% costs of conferences, courses, and workshops!

Team & values

  • Inclusive and open-minded organization that prioritizes learning

  • You'll be having lots of independence and trust

  • You will be proud of what you are working on! 💙

 

Sounds good? Here’s what comes next:

  1. Intro call (20-30 min) with Chris (CRO) - have a quick call so that we can make sure that our offer meets your expectations and vice versa!
  2. Technical interview (1h) with Chris (CRO) & Filip (Head of Sales Development) - hop on a video call so that we can chat about Growbots, our sales goals, strategies & team values. We'd also loved to get to know you better, so prepare for a couple of questions related to your knowledge & experience.
  3. Home task/case study (1-2h) - prepare a short recruitment task for us.
  4. Executive interview (30 min) with Luke (CEO) to make sure that you’ll find yourself aligned with our mission, culture & values!

 

If you have any questions don’t hesitate to ask Ewa, our Recruitment Specialist.

By clicking „apply” /or sending us your application/ you represent to have been informed how Growbots sp. z o.o.

will process your data as fully described in Growbots’ Recruitment Privacy Notice.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Lavin Media builds exceptional marketing solutions for large partners in the home improvement industry. We don’t just advertise our clients’ products or services - we build long-term marketing solutions within the context of permanent partnerships.

Our people are the backbone of everything we do and are our most valuable asset. Our business model demands top talent across the board, and we aim to create conditions that attract and retain the best individuals globally.


About you


We are looking for an A-Player who is client-focused, detail-oriented, self-motivated, digitally savvy, and results-driven. The Account Manager is responsible for maintaining and cultivating existing LM clients and working with the director of sales to grow the company.

As an Account Manager, you will play an important role, assisting with all facets of client services, and interacting with all departments including IT, media, creative, and analytics. This role provides a great opportunity for growth if you excel working in a fast-paced environment.

This role will be responsible for key business priorities that help amplify the growth of our business, share best practices, and implement operational improvements. Reporting to the Sales Director, this position requires superior account management skills, big picture thinking, and the ability to successfully lead cross-functional teams that collectively contribute to multifaceted digital campaigns.

At LM we embrace and respect the collective and unique talents, experiences, and perspectives of all people. We put a large emphasis on culture and personal characteristics.

Main responsibilities:


  • Effectively manage and grow positive client relationships
  • Provide weekly client status updates, capture action items, disseminate info across teams, and effectively manage expectations both internally and externally
  • Monitor timelines and progress on all client projects
  • Ensure clients are clear on all process-related questions and pivot where necessary
  • Develop workflow and process between internal teams & troubleshoot when issues occur
  • Develop project timelines and monitor progress
  • Facilitate the transition of new clients as they migrate to LM’s lead gen campaigns
  • Develop and maintain collaborative relationships with teams throughout the organization including Analytics, Creative, IT, and Media Buying
  • Maintain an in-depth knowledge of client businesses, current KPIs, and historical activity
  • Work with data team to forecast and track key assigned account metrics (e.g. weekly/monthly sales results and forecasts)
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and business opportunities
  • Proactively learn and understand industry best practices and future work concepts
  • 2+ years of relevant work experience
  • Efficient with Microsoft Office
  • Fluent in English
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to multitask, establish priorities and organize efficiently
  • Clearly communicate and present information
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple client needs against tight deadlines
  • Ability to work independently and remotely
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment
  • Capable of building and sustaining trust among clients and colleagues
  • Can see the bigger picture when working on granular tasks/projects to ensure everything stays on track


Personal Characteristics:

  • Smart, articulate, and polished, with excellent problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy is an absolute must
  • Ethical with a flexible work attitude
  • Humble and craving to learn
  • Must be a self-starter, highly organized
  • Quick learner and a team player
  • A can-do attitude and a desire to progress in their career
  • Self-motivated and goal-oriented
  • Curiosity, Honesty & Integrity
  • A self-starter who thrives on responsibility and impressing clients with results
  • Motivated to deliver exceptional performance
  • Strong desire to work in a multicultural environment



Nice to Have:

  • Previous success working in a completely remote role
  • Experience working at an agency or brand, managing digital marketing campaigns
  • Bachelor's degree in sales, marketing, business administration, or related field



Why do we deserve your attention?

Not only do we offer above-market compensation, but we also offer perks and benefits that promote people’s well–being. Here are some of them:


Remote Work

We offer a truly and fully remote environment. You choose where you are the most productive and comfortable to have an impact.


Ongoing Learning

People at Lavin are deeply inquisitive and eager to learn new knowledge and skills, that's why we support and create learning opportunities like the Free Books program, workshops, conferences, and more.


Home Office
